webLinks.linkText: City of Sydney - Sydney Streets series on Crown Street

properties.publicTransport: Buses will be diverting around Crown St while it's closed for the event. Check bus service alerts and plan your trip at transportnsw.info.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Sydney Streets Surry Hills - Clearways + Road Closure Map
arrangementAttachments.fileName: Sydney Streets Surry Hills - Clearways + Road Closure Map.pdf
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Sydney Streets Surry Hills - Clearways + Road Closure Map
arrangementAttachments.uniqueFileName: 909422_1678765041464_Sydney Streets Surry Hills - Clearways + Road Closure Map.pdf

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney Sydney Streets event on Crown Street, from 11am until 10pm.

  • Crown St will be closed in both directions between Cleveland St and Foveaux St from 9am until 11:30pm.
  • Sections of Arthur St, Collins St, Davies St, Devonshire St, Jesson L, Jesson St, Landsowne St, Miles St, Rainford St and Withers L will also be closed during this time.
  • Motorists travelling from the south towards the city should detour via Cleveland St, Elizabeth St and Albion St.
  • Motorists travelling from the north should detour via Foveaux St, Elizabeth St and Cleveland St.

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity

Special event clearways will also be in effect from 8am until 10:30pm on sections of Crown St, Arthur St, Collins St, Davies St, Landsdowne St, Rainford St and Withers L. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
ROAD CLOSURES

SURRY HILLS

FROM 9AM TO 11:30PM

  • Arthur St between Tudor Pl and Crown St
  • Arthur St between Crown St and Collins Ln
  • Collins St between Crown St and Richards Ln
  • Crown St between Cleveland St and Foveaux St
  • Davies St* between Bourke St and Crown St
  • Devonshire St^ between Wilshire St and Crown St (Westbound)
  • Jesson Ln from Jesson St
  • Jesson St at Crown St
  • Lansdowne St between High Holborn St and Crown St
  • Miles St* at Crown St
  • Rainford St between Crown St and Collins Ln
  • Withers Ln** between Riley St and Crown St

Notes:

* Resident access permitted - contraflow to Bourke St

^Light rail corridor at Devonshire St to remain open at all times

** Resident access permitted - contraflow High Holborn St to Lansdown St


SPECIAL EVENT CLEARWAYS

Special event clearways will be in effect on both sides of the roads below unless stated otherwise. Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.


SURRY HILLS

FROM 8AM UNTIL 10:30PM

  • Arthur St between Tudor Pl and Crown St
  • Arthur St between Crown St and Collins Ln
  • Collins St between Crown St and Richards Ln
  • Crown St between Cleveland St and Foveaux St
  • Davies St between Crown St and 20m east of Crown St
  • Lansdowne St between Crown St and 20m west of Crown St
  • Rainford St between Crown St and Collins Ln
  • Withers Ln between Withers Pl and Crown St
arrangementElements.title: Road closures and special event clearways

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 1,500 cyclists will take part in the 170km Maxi Classic and 110km Challenge Classic from 8am. Both rides start and finish at Banjo Patterson Park in Jindabyne and travel via Rocky Plain, Berridale, Dalgety and Beloka. The 170km ride continues to Perisher before returning to Jindabyne.

Major Road closures (please visit the Cycling Classics website for more detailed road closure information).

  • Jindabyne - between 5am and 7pm: sections of Kosciuszko Rd between Banjo Paterson Cres/Thredbo Tce & Barry Way at Banjo Patterson Park will be closed from 5am until 9:30am and from 5pm until 7pm. Local detours will be in place. From 9:30am until 5:30pm traffic will be reduced to one lane in both directions using northern/lake side lanes and the speed limited will be reduced 40km/h.
  • Jindabyne to East Jindabyne - 7:15am to 9:15am: Kosciuszko Rd from Munyang Street/Banjo Patterson Cres to Eucumbene Rd closed. 
  • East Jindabyne to Rocky Plain - 7:15am to 10am: Eucumbene Rd from Kosciuszko Rd to Rocky Plain Rd closed.
  • Rocky Plain to Berridale - between 8am and 10.45am: Rocky Plain Rd from Eucumbene Rd to Middlingbank Rd. From 8am until 11:10am Middlingbank Rd between Rocky Plain Rd and Jindabyne Rd closed.
  • Berridale - between 8.30am and 11:30am: Myack St from Kosciuszko Rd to Bobundara Rd closed.
  • Berridale to Dalgety - between 8.30am and 12.45pm: Dalgety Rd and Campbell St from Bobundara Rd to the Snowy River Way closed.
  • Dalgety to Jindabyne - 9am to 2pm: Snowy River Way from Campbell St, Dalgety to Barry Way closed. From 9.45am until 2.15pm Barry Way closed from from Snowy River Way to Kosciuszko Rd, Jindabyne.
  • Jindabyne to Perisher - 10am to 5.15pm: Kosciuszko Rd from Alpine Way to Perisher Village closed. No access to or from Perisher until 5.15pm.

Local roads will also be closed and access will be restricted, follow directions of traffic control on site.

Motorists should expect delays and allow plenty of extra travel time along the detour routes.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Rod Stewart with Cyndi Lauper. Acts start from 7:20pm, finish approx 11pm.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before the event.

properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Western Sydney Wanderers v Adelaide United at CommBank Stadium. Kick off from 7:45pm, finish around 9:40pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Parramatta CBD including O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as fans travel to the stadium.

Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium. Note, traffic changes for Parramatta Light Rail may affect how you travel through Parramatta CBD.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on trains is included in match tickets. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Rabbitohs v Storm at Accor Stadium. Kick-off from 8:05pm, full-time around 9:50pm.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are encourage to pre-book their parking online, available until 11:59pm the night before the event.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Central Coast Mariners v Brisbane Roar. Game starts at 5pm, finish around 7pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the game.

Dane Dr will be closed between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St before the match and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area

properties.publicTransport: Shuttle buses will run from Mudgee CBD and surrounding townships to and from the stadium. For more information visit transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Sea Eagles v Knights at Glen Willow Stadium in Mudgee. Preliminary game from 12:30pm, NRL kick-off at 3pm and full-time around 5pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual through Mudgee and along Ulan Rd, Lue Rd and Church St as crowds travel to and from the stadium.

Allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

No public parking will be permitted at the venue or on Pitts Lane on game day, and there will be no parking available at Mudgee Racecourse.

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on trains. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Sharks v Warriors at PointsBet Stadium in Woolooware. Kick-off from 4:05pm and full-time around 6pm. 

Road closures will be in place on Captain Cook Drive from approximately 10 minutes before kick off and remain in place until crowds have cleared after full-time.

Traffic on roads approaching the stadium may be heavier than usual including Captain Cook Dr, Woolooware Rd and Gannons Rd. 

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Dragons v Dolphins at WIN Stadium. Kick-off from 5:30pm, full time approx 7pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Burelli St, Corrimal St, Stewart St and Crown St as fans travel to and from the game.

Local roads around the stadium may close before, during and after the game for the safety of pedestrians.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on trains is included in match tickets. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Bulldogs v Cowboys at Accor Stadium. Kick-off from 6:15pm, full-time around 8pm.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are encouraged to pre-book their parking online, available until 11:59pm the night before the event.

AFL: GWS Giants v Carlton at GIANTS Stadium. First bounce at 4:35pm, finish approx 6:30pm.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before the event.

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL Round 9: St George-Illawarra Dragons v Bulldogs. Kick-off is at approx 4 pm on Sunday 30 April.


﻿A road closure on Harbour Street from Crown Street to Stewart Street will be implemented to allow safe pedestrian access.


Traffic may be heavier than usual on Burelli St, Corrimal St, Stewart St and Crown St as fans travel to and from the game.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Harbour Street from Crown Street to Stewart Street

properties.publicTransport: Buses run regularly to Rosehill Gardens from Parramatta Interchange. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Caravan Camping Supershow at Rosehill Gardens will be held from Tuesday 18 to Sunday 23 April from 9:30am to 5pm from Tuesday to Saturday and from 9:30am to 4pm on Sunday.

Traffic is expected to be heavier than usual on James Ruse Drive and Hassall Street before and after the event each day, particularly over the weekend.

On-site parking will be in high demand as is expected to fill. Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity around the racecourse.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 7am to 5pm daily from Thursday 13 to Monday 17 April on Grand Avenue from 100m prior to Gate 1 Australian Turf Club Rosehill Gardens to opposite Grand Avenue North (southern side).

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and also apply to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed call 132 701 to find its new location.

The Blessing of the Fleet will take place on Sunday 9 April between 8 am and 7 pm on the Princes Highway between North Street and Deering Street.

A detour will be in place via Deering Street and Vincent Street.

Motorists are advised to exercise caution in the area with an expected increase in pedestrian activity.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
St George-Illawarra Dragons v Dolphins. Kick-off is at 5.30 pm on Saturday 1 April.


A road closure on Harbour Street from Crown Street to Stewart Street will be implemented to allow safe pedestrian access.


Traffic may be heavier than usual on Burelli St, Corrimal St, Stewart St and Crown St as fans travel to and from the game.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Harbour Street from Crown Street to Stewart Street

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Run2Cure fun run events will take place in The Domain starting from 6.30am finishing around 1pm. Approximtaley 3,500 participants are expected.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching The Domain as participants travel to and from the event.

Art Gallery Rd and Mrs Macquaries Rd will be closed from 5am to 11.30am. No vehicle access or parking will be permitted until roads are reopened.

Hospital Rd will remain open with limited parking and a drop off zone located immediately south of the pedestrian crossing on the corner of Hospital Rd and Phillip Path. Parking is available in the Domain car park.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on public transport is included in tickets to the Show. Express trains and Major Event Buses will run daily. Regular route buses 525, 526 and N81 in Olympic Park will use different stops while roads are closed. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Hundreds of thousands of people are expected to visit the annual Sydney Royal Easter Show over 12 days at Sydney Olympic Park from Thursday 6 April until Monday 17 April. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd throughout the show, particularly over the Easter Long Weekend. 

It is essential to pre-book parking online for those driving to the event (available until 11.59pm the night before your visit) to secure a space as parking will fill early or sell out in advance.

Road closures and changes to parklands will be in place within the Sydney Olympic Park Precinct from Thursday 23 March until Wednesday 26 April 2023 before, during and after the Easter Show including sections of Dawn Fraser Ave, Olympic Blvd, Showground Rd, Murray Rose Ave, Kevin Coombs Ave, Marjorie Jackson Pwy, Shirley Strickland Ave, Rod Laver Dr. Check out the Sydney Olympic Park Authority interactive map or Easter Show closure listing for more details.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Dr, Epping Rd, Lane Cove Rd

properties.otherAdvice:
A Day on the Green will be held at Centennial Vineyards on 2 April from 2pm to 9.30pm.

Reduced speed and stop-slow traffic management will be in place on Mittagong Rd as motorists arrive and leave the event.

Centennial Rd will be closed from Centennial Vineyards to the Old Hume Highway at the conclusion of the event.

Traffic controllers will be on-site to direct motorists.

roads.crossStreet: Centennial Vinyards to Old Hume Highway

properties.otherAdvice:
Special event clearways will be in effect on a section of Harrington St at The Rocks for a Police Operation from 12pm midday Sunday 26 March to 2pm Wednesday 29 March. 

  • Harrington St: from end of bike allocated parking to the corner of Essex St (eastern side)
  • Harrington St: from 111 Harrington St to the end of Loading Zone (western side)

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and for local residents or TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully for the most up-to-date information as vehicles left in signposted clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed call 132 701 to find its new location.

properties.publicTransport: Shuttle buses will run from local areas. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Ramadan Night markets on Haldon St from Tue 21 Mar to Thu 20 Apr from 5pm to 3am nightly.

Heavy traffic is expected in the area, particularly on Thursday – Sunday nights during the festival.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra time as roads will be closed around Lakemba Station and detours will be in place.

The following road closures will be in place from 4pm to 3am each night from Tue 21 Mar to Thu 20 Apr:

  • Haldon St between Railway Pde and The Boulevarde
  • Haldon St between 178 Haldon St and Grace Ave
  • The Boulevarde between Croydon St and Oneata Ln
  • The Boulevarde between Quigg St and Haldon St
  • Gillies St between Quigg St and Haldon St
  • Oneata St between Croydon St Haldon St

Follow the directions of traffic controllers and NSW Police on site.
properties.diversions:
Southbound traffic on Haldon St north of the railway line will be detoured using Railway Pde, Moreton St, The Blvd, Quigg St, Grace Ave and Haldon St to Canterbury Rd.

Northbound traffic on Haldon St will be detoured using Grace Ave, Quigg St, The Blvd and Moreton St to Lakemba St.

Eastbound traffic on The Blvd west of Haldon St will be detoured using Croydon St to Canterbury Rd.

Westbound traffic on The Blvd east of Haldon St will be detoured using Quigg St, Grace Ave andHaldon St to Canterbury Rd.

properties.otherAdvice: The Millthorpe Markets will take place at Redmond Oval, Millthorpe on Sun 2 Apr between 8:30am and 3:00pm. Motorists should be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area and follow the direction of signs and traffic controllers.

properties.publicTransport: There will be free local shuttle buses and paid coach services available, as there is no parking onsite.
properties.otherAdvice: The Hunter Valley Airshow will be held on Saturday 25 and Sunday 26 March 2023 from 9am to 5pm at Cessnock Airport. There will be a 40km/hr speed limit and traffic control in place during the event. There will also be increased pedestrian activity as people make their way to and from the event so motorists are reminded to slow down and exercise caution. Minor delays are expected.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on public transport to and from Moore Park is included in your ticket to the game. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

properties.otherAdvice:
AFL: Sydney Swans v Hawthorn Hawks at The Sydney Cricket Ground Gates open 11:10am, first bounce 1:10pm and finish 3:50pm

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd as fans travel to and from the game.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 10:15am and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave, however access to EP2 Kippax car park will be maintained via Moore Park Rd and access to EP3 grass car park and drop off areas maintained from Lang Rd.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 11am to 6pm on sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and also apply to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies

Red Hot Summer Tour at Bella Vista Farm from 1.10pm until approx. 9pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the event site particularly at the start and the end of the event.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on Norwest Blvd, Elizabeth MacArthur Dr and Westwood Way.

Exercise caution and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before the event.

properties.otherAdvice:
The Spot Festival in Randwick on St Pauls Street and Perouse Road from 1pm until 8pm.

Heavy traffic is expected on roads in the area while crowds travel to and from the event, and road closures are in place. Motorists should allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

From 4am, sections of Perouse Road and St Pauls Street will be closed until midnight. Motorists will be detoured via local roads. 

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in the area from 10:30pm Saturday 25 March until 11.59pm Sunday 26 March on sections of Perouse Road, St Pauls Street, Nancy Street and Soudan Street. A clearway will also be in place on the southern side of Aeolia Street from 4pm Thursday 23 March.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed call 132 701 to find its new location.

arrangementElements.html:
ROAD CLOSURES

From 4am until 11:50pm on Sunday 26 March:

  • Perouse Road between Soudan Street and Barker Street
  • St Pauls Street between Dine Street and Nancye Street

Partial road closures will also be in place on several surrounding streets however local access will be maintained. 

SPECIAL EVENT CLEARWAYS

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

From 4pm Thursday 23 March until 11:59pm Sunday 26 March

  • Aeolia Street, between Perouse Road and Aeolia Lane (westbound)

From 10:30pm Saturday 25 March until 11:59pm Sunday 26 March

  • Nancye Street, St Pauls Street entrace (southbound)
  • St Pauls Street between Dine Street and Daintrey Crescent (both directions)
  • Perouse Road between Soudan Street and Barker Street (both directions)
  • Soudan Street between St Pauls Lane and Perouse Road (westbound)
arrangementElements.title: Road closures & Special event clearways

webLinks.linkText: RSL NSW - Anzac Day Sydney CBD
NSW Gov - Anzac Day in NSW

properties.publicTransport: Travel on public transport is free on Anzac Day and additional early morning services will run. Buses will be diverting while roads are closed and Light rail services will not run between Circular Quay and Town Hall until 6am during the Dawn Service. Visit transportnsw.info for details.
properties.otherAdvice:
Major roads will be closed in the Sydney CBD for the Anzac Day Dawn Service in Martin Place from 4.15am and March on Elizabeth St from 9am. 

Motorists should avoid travelling through the CBD while roads are closed or expect delays and allow extra travel time. While roads are closed travel east/west across the CBD is maintained via Bridge St or via Goulburn St.

Key road closures:

  • From 2am to 4pm: Pitt St, George St and Castlereagh St between Hunter and King Streets. Local streets will also be closed including Hosking Pl, De Mestre Pl and Wynyard Ln.
  • From 2am to 6pm: Angel Pl and Ash St.
  • From 6am to 4pm: Major roads between Bridge St in Circular Quay and Goulburn St in the CBD South including sections of Castlereagh St, Elizabeth St, King St, Market St, Margaret St, Hunter St, O’Connell St, Gresham St, Bent St, Park St, Bathurst St, Bond St, Bligh St, Phillip St, Loftus St and Liverpool St.

There will be no managed vehicle access or access to/from driveways within the road closure footprint for the safety of participants and spectators. Pedestrians can cross the march route at the designated crossing point on Elizabeth St at Park St, Bathurst St and at Museum Station.

Cycleway closures will be in place on Pitt St from 2am to 4pm and sections of King, Liverpool, Park, Pitt and Phillip Streets from 6am to 4pm.

Extensive special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect on various major roads in the Sydney CBD from 1am around Martin Place and from 5.30am until 4pm on other major roads.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents, businesses or TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies so check signs carefully on the day and the night before as clearways come into effect in the early morning. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies so check signs carefully on the day and the night before as clearways come into effect in the early morning. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in match tickets. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
AFL: Swans v Port Adelaide at SCG. First bounce from 7:30pm and full-time around 10:10pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual as thousands of fans travel to the stadium. Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 4:30pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave, however access to EP2 Kippax car park will be maintained via Moore Park Rd and access to EP3 grass car park and drop off areas maintained from Lang Rd.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until 11pm including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides)
  • Moore Park Road between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Greens Road (northern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Cook Road and Poate Road (southern side)

A-League Men: Sydney FC v Western United FC at Allianz Stadium. Start from 7:45pm and finish approx. 9:30pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual as fans travel to the stadium. Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 3:45pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave. access to EP3 grass car park and drop off areas maintained from Lang Rd.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm to 11pm on sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Roosters v Eels at Allianz Stadium. Kick-off from 7:50pm and full-time around 9:50pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual as fans travel to the stadium. Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 5:50pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave. access to EP3 grass car park and drop off areas maintained from Lang Rd.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until 11pm including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.publicTransport: Race day tickets include travel on public transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Championship Day 1 at Royal Randwick Racecourse. First race from 10:45am, last race at 5:50pm and concert from 6pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as crowds travel to and from the races.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads around the racecourse at the following times and locations:

  • 4am – 7pm: Darley Road between Alison Road and Centennial Park round-a-bout (western side)
  • 8am – 7pm: Ascot Street between Doncaster Avenue and Randwick Racecourse Ascot Street entry (both sides)
  • 3pm – 7pm: High Street between UNSW Gate 2 and Anzac Parade (southern side)

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

roads.mainStreet: Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.
